definition: to deceive/to cheat/to hoodwink/to make a wild guess
to deceive/to cheat/to hoodwink/to make a wild guess

sentences.english: Jo was the first to wake in the gray dawn of Christmas morning.
sentences.chinese: 聖誕節一早，天剛矇矇亮，喬便第一個醒來。

sentences.english: Jo was the first to wake in the grey dawn of Christmas morning.
sentences.chinese: 聖誕節一早，天剛矇矇亮，喬便第一個醒來。

sentences.english: At dawn, the whole town wakes to recorded patriotic songs and messages blared from loudspeakers.
sentences.chinese: 天矇矇亮，喇叭裏就響徹着愛國歌曲和語錄。

sentences.english: It was near daybreak when we arrived at Chongding Village.
sentences.chinese: 我們走到重丁村時，天終於矇矇亮了。

sentences.english: When I arrived, it was early moring and it was raining.
sentences.chinese: 當我到達的時候天才矇矇亮仍然下着小雨。

sentences.english: In the morning twilight of mid-summer I began my search and visit in Wuhu.
sentences.chinese: 我在盛夏矇矇亮的蕪湖清晨開始尋找和探望了。

sentences.english: When there is a little light I feed the dogs.
sentences.chinese: 當天矇矇亮時，我餵了狗。

sentences.english: I first met them in the half-light of an early dawn.
sentences.chinese: 我第一次遇見他們是在黎明矇矇亮的時候。

sentences.english: They got the soldiers up well before dawn.
sentences.chinese: 天矇矇亮他們就叫士兵們起牀。
